verses.roman:
sa kadācid bhramaṁs tasmin
pṛthivyāḥ kakudi dvijaḥ
nyāgrodha-potaṁ dadṛśe
phala-pallava-śobhitam

synonyms: saḥ—he; kadācit—on one occasion; bhraman—while wandering; tasmin—in that water; pṛthivyāḥ—of earth; kakudi—upon a raised place; dvijaḥ—the brāhmaṇa; nyāgrodha-potam—a young banyan tree; dadṛśe—saw; phala—with fruits; pallava—and blossoms; śobhitam—decorated.
translation: Once, while wandering in the water, the brāhmaṇa Mārkaṇḍeya discovered a small island, upon which stood a young banyan tree bearing blossoms and fruits.
